website_summaries.verdict: Sennheiser's new (and very expensive) PXC 450 NoiseGard headphones outdo Bose in both killing ambient noise and providing excellent audio performance.
pros: Passive mode for music listening only
cons: Volume controls hard to use when in place

customer_reviews.title: Better sound quality but worse noise cancellation than some other brands
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality exceeds that of Bose QC20 in-ear 'phones, but active noise cancellation is not as good as the Bose. I ended up getting the Bose as well, for the sake of the noise cancellation. For riding in a noisy car, the Sennheisers are good, but not for office noise; they work primarily on lower frequency noise. The ability to push a button to hear what someone is saying is useful. With noise cancelation turned off, the sound quality is adequate. They are no match for the Sennheiser HD595, but hold their own with the HD280 pro. The passive noise reduction from the HD280 pro is nowhere near as effective as the active noise reduction from the PXC450.
customer_reviews.author: S. Puppala

customer_reviews.title: Very ill fitting
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed with these compared to Bose, Monoprice, and Audio Technica. They have noise cancellation comparable to Bose and Monoprice, sound quality comparable to Bose and Audio Technica (which are not noise cancelling), and are much more durably made than the flimsy Bose, but they do not fit snuggly on my head like all the others. In order to block out noise I have to bungee cord them around my head (okay, I actually use a headband) which gives me a headache after a while. I cannot figure out how to adjust them.
customer_reviews.author: vic

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 2 hours into a 6 hour flight - BRAND NEW.  First time used.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working the first time I used them in the middle of a flight. The noise cancelling feature continued to work, but no sound would come from any device that I attached it to. Serves me right - I bought this new set to replace a set I had for several years that stopped working when it developed a short in the cord. Sennheiser had a flat rate to repair that cost almost as much as a new set so I ordered a new one. I have had it with Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: Westchester Rick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones -- this is not a technical review.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these noise-canceling headphones to replace my Bose Q15 ones, which finally broke (literally). I really like the Sennheisers. They are comfortable. The sound from movies and songs is excellent. I have another pair of Sennheisers, not noise-canceling, that must be over 20 years old, and they are still outstanding. I would recommend these highly.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Foisy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best sound, not heavy at all
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and returned 3 different brands before keeping this one. Absolutely the best sound, not heavy at all, not like some of the newer brands, great sound canceling, great frequency range, not too heavy of bass, over the ear insulation to keep ambient noise out and you can still listed to music should the the battery run out, which you cannot do with Bose and Beats. Also, I actually prefer being able to change the batteries, not like some that have rechargeable batteries built in were when your batteries run out you can no longer use them. Sennheiser is a great German brand. I recommend spend the extra $, get the best and keep it for life.
customer_reviews.author: Menzhausen’s

customer_reviews.title: Sufficiently advanced technology
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Had to fly to the other side of the world (25 hours of flight time across three flights to get there). One battery lasted the whole way easily, and the headphones are physically comfortable enough that I was not bothered having them on my head that long. They're not cheap, but the amount of comfort they will add to your flight time is worth it. I'd love to take these back in time 40 or 50 years, and see the look on the face of someone who tried them on an airliner back then. We live in the future, so we might as well enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones. They sound great with the noise cancellation on, sound okay in "bypass" mode with noise cancellation disabled. This also means that they work as regular headphones without a battery. A common complaint with noise cancelling headphones is that they apply a lot of pressure on the ears. There is some pressure with these, but nothing unbearable. Just don't wear them in a flight that's taking off or landing. Noise cancelling headphones don't work in certain kinds of noise, and a flight taking off or landing, they just make the experience worse. For the rest of the flight? They reduce engine noise just enough so that it's not annoying. Best investment for a frequent flyer.
customer_reviews.author: Pedantic Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, awesome noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: I have good normal headphones, and the PXC 450 is about the same overall sound quality...until you enable the noise cancellation. Then, you end up with studio quality even in normal surroundings. They seem to go through batteries fairly quickly (about 40 hours of listening), but they are standard AAA, so it's not expensive, and the time is still long enough that you can get through a dozen cross-country flights on one battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Rife

customer_reviews.title: leaving me really disappointed until I finally figured it out
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these did not work because the 'Normal' - 'Bypass' switch, which is well hidden behind one of the earpiece arms, came switched to the 'bypass' position, thus the noise-cancelling feature did not initially operate, leaving me really disappointed until I finally figured it out. Now that I've experienced the true functionality, I'm impressed. I was able to listen to music in a room where other music was playing over a speaker. I can't wait to try them on an airplane next week.
customer_reviews.author: El Phil

customer_reviews.title: Adds noise due to bad shielding. Disappointing overall performance
customer_reviews.text: Audio is below high end. Noise cancelling works fine, except for fan noise. DECT phone transmitter signal is picked up by the noise cancelling electronic from 2 meters apart and adding noise to the signal instead of cancelling. Poor job of shielding the electronic against EMC. The battery got drained in standby, you need to take it out before store away. I expected better performance for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kerstin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Though Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought theses for a transatlantic flight and they did a good job of cancelling out the aircraft noise, but don't think you'll be sitting there in blissful silence. The audio is very very good though perhaps not quite as good as Sennheiser's regular (i.e not noise cancelling) headphones. The battery life? Well, two 10-hour transatlantic flights on one set of batteries and they're still going strong, so no complaints there. The case is good and sturdy as well, and a plane seat one into two headphone jack comes with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Darren H

customer_reviews.title: Works for only one year
customer_reviews.text: - It is a little large - The cable is annoying - The noise cancelling worked pretty well for a while - The noise cancelling stopped working after a year! - Not worth the purchase ...
customer_reviews.author: The Consultant!

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for a long flight
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a recent trip to India from the US. The biggest like is that they were comfortable for MANY hours of use. They didn't squeeze my head and they didn't shift or fall off. The sound is very clean and clear. Like others, I don't think they do as good a job on active noise cancellation as their competition but the over the ear style help block sound physically. The talk-through feature is really convenient except that the flight attendants don't know about it and don't try to talk to you when you're wearing headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent High-Quality Product - 1st unit after 3 Bose NC purchases
customer_reviews.text: Over the past 8 years or so, I've purchased three Bose NC units, while audio was very good, they all broke within 2 years (used tape to hold them together on some flights) and they were all too tight around my head (I'm 6'5"). On long international flights I got headaches at times. Decided after reading most reviews to buy this unit - it is absolutely awesome! Quality is superb, I honestly cannot tell the different in NC quality vs. Bose and it's not too heavy as well. Very happy - highly recommend. Max
customer_reviews.author: Max Hamel

customer_reviews.title: ... trip have been trying to use them and get comfortable with them
customer_reviews.text: So I go these to go to Thialand and prior to the trip have been trying to use them and get comfortable with them. My biggest complaint is how much they weigh. If you are sitting straight up for over an hour these weigh your head down and even make my ears start to hurt after awhile but they sound wonderful and do help a great deal with keeping the outside noise out.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Meador

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've used these both for travel on a plane as well as with my iPhone for listening to music and playing games. They are by far some of the finest quality headphones I have ever listened to. It is a true and accurate sound as opposed to the heavy bass accents offered by some of the competitors. If you like hearing music that is accurately reproduced, give these a try. Wait for them to be on sale, as they often are. You should be able to pick them up around $200 as opposed to the $350 full retail price.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoors Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a couple of years ago to be able to work next to a very loud co-worker, they worked wonders! I read what everyone said about the base and punch they lacked to I purchased a Boostaroo amplifier for less that $10.00 bucks and let me tell you that made all the difference. The power from my iPhone was not enough for these bad boys so having the Boostaroo is a must. They are so comfortable you can lay down in bed and fall asleep - I've taken them on many trips and they block out airplane noise very well. Even after 2 years of use they still seem like new.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I just got these from UPS and plugged them into my iPhone. I was having trouble with my Bose earbuds on airplanes with hearing all the screaming babies and people talking when I was listening to music and watching movies. I am 100% sure that these will fix that problem, and that's without the NC feature even on. I haven't even put batteries in. I can barely hear myself talk without music on. The sound is fantastic and all reviews say the burn in over hours of listening will make them better. The bass is deep, the highs and mids are perfect. I couldn't be happier, especially without evening listening before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Lee I.

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality on these is pretty decent. The sound canceling is decent as well
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on these is pretty decent. The sound canceling is decent as well. They are the most comfortable headphones I've ever found. 6 years later and the only issue I have is that the padding is disintegrating leaving black pieces of foam on your face when you wear them. Which is to be expected with how old they are.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary C.

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Noise elimination is very good, the "talk through" feature is really cool. The sound from these is just incredible. I'm not an audiophile, but I love listening to music from my iPhone and iPad through headphones. These headphones make listening very enjoyable. Because of their noise elimination and the detail of sound they create, there is no need to blast the volume. I can listen at a very comfortable level and really enjoy the music, and for longer periods of time. Features are excellent, they feel solid and appear to be capable of lasting for a long time. Expensive, but highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PV29

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headsets
customer_reviews.text: I bought the PXC 450 to replace a cheap pair of noise-cancellation headphones. I really enjoy using these headphones, especially when we travel. My husband understood my enthusiasm for the PXC 450 when he tried them. He ended buying a pair of PXC 450 for himself. :) PROS: 1. The PXC 450 is very comfortable to wear for several hours at a time. I also wear glasses. 2. The noise-cancellation abilities of these headphones blocks out crying kids and noisy airplane engines. Yay !! :) 3. The talk-through function is very handy when conversing. CON: 1. The carrying case is bulky. Roughly about 7.5" x 9" x 1.5".
customer_reviews.author: Tina V. Wright

customer_reviews.title: An absolute must have if you fly. I usually ...
customer_reviews.text: An absolute must have if you fly. I usually get the screaming kid sitting behind me when I fly. It used to make me an angry butt munch to fly with. Not anymore. I just put these on and it's smooth sailing. peanuts and coke. Yes please and thank you. Do your research and check your specs. Make a bookmark here. because you'll be coming back.
customer_reviews.author: jordan b watts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Seems every flight I've been on since purchasing these has at least one screaming child; but I don't care because these headphones work so well. Sound quality is excellent as expected from Sennheiser. Noise cancelling is very effective, much better than expected. Fit is comfortable, even on longer cross country flights. Only minor complaints are there's no audible low battery warning, it just dies and you notice the absence of noise cancelling. And the pass through function for talking seems to amplify the cancelled noise rather than simply muting the music which would be more effective.
customer_reviews.author: CO Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect headphones for church audio monitoring
customer_reviews.text: I needed NC headphones for monitoring recording during church services. I tried the Audio-Technica ATH-ANC7B headphones and found that the ear cups were too small and didn't extend far enough to cover my ears adequately. The Sennheiser PSC 450 headphones are plenty large and very comfortable. I also like the talk-through feature. The noise cancellation is probably a little short of the Bose QuietComfort 15 but more than adequate for me to hear the recording signal distinctly separate from the house signal. I had to pay twice the price of the ATH-ANC7B's but the difference is worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are freaking awesome! For the first time
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are freaking awesome! For the first time... EVER.. I was able to sleep on an airplane. Don't get me wrong, you will still hear a slight rumble from the engines, but it has to cutdown 90% of the overall noise. They are huge, but well worth the investment if you are looking for great sounding headphones that can cut out airplane noise.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bicking

customer_reviews.title: Good pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones to decrease part for listening to music and part for giving myself a noise-less environment when Im in need of concentrating. I find them to be a good fit as they are comfortable sitting on my head. They are quite loud to bystanders and the noise-cancellation is good but not great. Another thing to note is that the battery runs out fairly fast if you are using them as noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The best sounding headphones I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: The noise canceling on these works like no other, better than bose headphones I have bought in the past. When wearing these the outside world is gone. The headphones play all types of music great, and actually have a fair amount of bass with them as well. They are very light for the sound you get and I don't even notice any harmonic distortion. The frequency range is great and I'm hearing more parts of the music I listen to then ever before. Highly recommend for any type of music listener.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Not great but still pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones to drown out the loud noise of all the equipment i'm around all day. They do a good job to the point where I know the equipment is there but only if I think about it. The only reason these didn't receive a full 5 stars, was because of the lack of bass. Don't get me wrong, they have a little bit of kick to them, just not enough for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Good choice. Used mainly on transpacific flights which I ...
customer_reviews.text: Horton Hears a Who--and quite a bit more. I bought these to replace a surprisingly effective and relatively inexpensive pair of Phillips that are no longer made. I had tried Bose and others, but after reading through the reviews here, I decided on the Senns. Good choice. Used mainly on transpacific flights which I regularly take, the headphones were wonderful. Comfortable noise reduction and pretty good dynamic range in the music. I would like to note that unlike a lot of other headphones, these do not push the bass forward. It is noticeable, but not problematic. All in all, I would recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Kwilinski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound Quality and Pertfect fit
customer_reviews.text: The first thing that I am amazed is the quality of sound these headphones can produce. I have used Bose QC15 and sound quality on PXC450 headphones is way better than Bose and the noise cancelling is pretty much same in both (or I couldn't find any difference). At first I was scared with reviews on these headphones being big and not fitting an average ear, but then I bought it anyway to try it out. Their fit is fantastic to my ears. The headphones were on for 3 hours straight without any discomfort. I am totally impressed and fully satisfied customer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vachaspathy Kuntamukkala

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My second pair. First one lasted a several years of constant use (almost daily, plus heavy travel). Had to replace the ear pads after 2-3 years as they got worn down and started to flake. After another year, I lost electrical connection on one side. did some at home fixes until I saw them for sale again. Extremely happy with the sound quality and noise canceling. I think the wear and tear I experiences was perfectly reasonable for the amount I used them
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B Barbour

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: After giving it a few days, I discovered for my head these are WAY too big and WAY too heavy. They are too bulky for portable use, so forget about that. Without an amplifier these are nearly useless for trance, or even metal (double bass, etc). A normal battery dies in about a day or two for noise cancellation and switching for a new one is too inconvenient for how much these cost. If you are a small person with a relatively small head like me, skip these. They are nearly unbearable for any amount longer than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tatsh

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser v. Bose personal summary
customer_reviews.text: Definitely impressed with this product. I was stuck between these and the Bose QC 15 for my final decision. I knew how the Bose set performed, and I wanted to give these a try, especially when they were cheaper. Basically, you get higher audio quality but an ever-so-slight (and barely noticeable) loss in noise canceling compered to the QC 15s, as well as having the ability to play audio passively when the battery dies, which the Bose cannot do. So it depends on what is more important to you between the two products.
customer_reviews.author: TK-422

customer_reviews.title: Will never travel without them again!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I've lived my whole life without noise cancelling headphones. I will never ever be able to travel without them again. I have also tried the Bose QC 15's and these are in a league all their own. The sound quality is great, the noise cancellation is super effective, and they're extremely comfortable. The talk through feature is also awesome. I ended up buying my boyfriend the same pair and he loves them too!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Snodgrass

customer_reviews.title: Compare to Bose 15
customer_reviews.text: Ok I have used this on 3 cross country trips now. Compared to a Bose Quiet Comfort 15 these do not block sound as well, close but not quite. They are heavier, they are better made, they have a great feature that allows you to press a button to hear people speaking to you. They use up the battery quicker. I would say twice as fast as the Bose. Overall I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I'm rather disappointed in the sound performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the quality construction, case and controls. However, I'm rather disappointed in the sound performance. When compared to other headphones I own, the sound is about half as loud. Purchased for a long flight and the sound level on maximum volume was too low to hear a movie on my I-Pad.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth it on sale.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when they were on sale, expecting their high price to be somewhat of a guarantee they'd be of reasonable quality. Woops. - Bad fit: They don't fit properly over my ears, which means there's not a good seal, allowing outside sound to leak in. - Uncomfortable: Hurts to wear for even short periods, and despite there being room for sound to leak in, it still gets quite hot in there. - Clumsiest controls: Just an awfully designed interface.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best noise cancelling ability, but very good sound.
customer_reviews.text: When compared to Bose QC-15, these headphones have superior sound quality, but inferior noise cancelling ability. Also, the controls are more difficult to operate than those on the Bose. I made the change because the Bose QC-15 build quality was very poor and the headphones failed in about 15 months. I am hoping the Sennheisers last much longer than that, but my first impression is that the build quality is not any better..
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Rosenbaum

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable, better built than Bose QC15. Work better to lower voice volume.
customer_reviews.text: After having used Bose QC15, which are the benchmark in Noise Cancellation but not that great as far as sound quality goes, this Sennheiser PXC 450 is a welcome change. These are more comfortable than the Bose headphones especially for those with slightly larger ears or heads. The noise cancellation is 95% as good as the Bose on the lower end frequencies, but these also cancel a bit of the higher frequencies, such as a bit of voice as well. They don't cancel voice, but they reduce the volume considerably, and the Talk through feature works wonders, and that is what sealed the deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Varun Singh

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable headphones, a bit heavy on batteries
customer_reviews.text: Great noise cancelling headphones. The pass-through functionality is pretty great - red light when noise cancelling active, hit a button on the side, light goes green, and you can hear people talking. Handy for an office situation where you don't want to take your headphones off every time someone comes in to talk to you. Knocked a star off because it does eat batteries a bit compared to my Bose noise cancelling headphones.
customer_reviews.author: ultrahax

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect! Remember to switch the mode to normal.
customer_reviews.text: Much better built quality than bose QC 15, but as a result it is heavier. The noise cancelation is really good, if you switch the mode to "normal" on your left. At very beginning, I tested it on "bypass" mode, and I didn't realize there was a button hiden on the left side. So I really didn't feel any difference between turning the headphone on or off. After reading the manual, I figured it out and switched, and then low frequency noise just disappeared, which is amazing! I don't know if those, who claim the noise cancelation is bad, put the normal mode on. At the beginning I was disappointed too.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: A revelation after using earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a while ago, enjoyed them, then started using earbuds at the gym and forgot about the headphones. Today I took them out again to try them before a trip and wham! what a difference. The sound is wonderful and the fit is comfortable. I wouldn't wear them at the gym but I will start using them again for anywhere else. I will say that they go through batteries even when turned off so that may be a negative for some but for me its a small price to pay for the awesome sound.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Erlanger

customer_reviews.title: omg, these things are amazing
customer_reviews.text: i just flew business class to japan and AA gave me a pair of NC bose to use. they were good, and it got me looking at the market for these sort of NC headphones. omg, these leave the Bose in the dust. and i am a big bose fan, having a complete surround sound with them and their ipod system was awesome too. but these things. i may never take them off. expensive yes, but at this level you indeed get what you pay for. if you have the coin, and like to listen, this is the pair....
customer_reviews.author: Curtis C. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy. Excellent sound quality. Well built. Talk through feature is a bonus. These are like volvos, as good as any bmw (Bose), just not as cool looking. I went for build, sound and comfort over sound and looks. They are also $80 cheaper than the q25s. Try them both if you're not convinced.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie & Stuart Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Good product but not long lasting for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Noise reducer broke down reasonably quickly, like soon after the warranty expired. But they worked great while they lasted. Case wasn’t then greatest, but functional.
customer_reviews.author: user 313

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound, Noise suppression could be stronger.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality, I wish the noise suppression was more complete. Some sound definitely comes through although voices are pretty much cancelled. I also tried some Sony wireless noise cancelling headphones and the sound quality and noise suppression were both very noticeably better on the Sennheiser. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: R2J2

customer_reviews.title: Great noise cancellation!
customer_reviews.text: Researched the heck out of these - I had to be convinced that they they would out perform the Bose set I bought for my daughter last year to block out the noise of her crowded dorm. She reports they have better noise cancellation, the sound is 'awesome,' and they are really 'comfy.' Verdict: Straight A's.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but big, sweaty, and poor noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Previously owned the Bose noise cancelling headphones. These are definitely much more solidly built, and have great sound quality. However, they are a bit bulky, and make my ears sweat after only 15 minutes use. Also, the Bose noise cancelling works for about 90% of the sound when used on an airplane, these barely make a difference. Since I primarily bought them for noise cancelling, I was disappointed. They were refurbished on Amazon, but look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Joseppi D

customer_reviews.title: more comfortable and boast clearly superior fidelity
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my Bose QC15's, these are of higher quality construction, more comfortable and boast clearly superior fidelity. Too bad they don't cancel noise nearly as well. I would choose these for listening to music in mildly noisy environments or to audio books on an airplane, but for listening to music on an airplane stick with the Bose!
customer_reviews.author: Rogue Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like these headphones. The sound is good and the noise reduction seems to work very well. What I don't actually care for is the size of the headphones - they are very large. If I were a large person (and with proportionally large ears) these would be perfect. It still seems to seal off the sound and work like they should. I got them on sale for a really great price (comparable to the nearest competitor) - I would not have paid full price for these.
customer_reviews.author: Marijo Puleo

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I love them overall - the only problem I have is that the speaker inside the ear cup bumps into my ear and is a bit uncomfortable - if your ears are shaped differently from mine, you may have no issues with this :) I also love the fact that I can use them as regular headphones if the battery dies out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I am quite happy with my purchase of these headphones. I work in an avionics lab that has a constant high pitch whine from all of the equipment. These headphones are able to cut that whine almost completely. The talk through feature works very well, although I feel silly talking to coworkers with my head phones still on. It feels disrespectful. The first time I turned on the noise cancellation was surreal. Its weird hearing nothing. It takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Good headset.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is very high (at least as far as my untrained ears can tell). The noise-cancelling is not as good as that of certain competitors, but the headset can work without batteries, which is a very nice plus. (N.B. when using the no-battery mode, make sure there is no battery inside! Having some causes parasitic noises with mine.) It is very comfortable for extended periods of time, and seems quite sturdy / resistant. I would buy it again if I lost mine.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent P.

customer_reviews.title: These are the best headphones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I've ever had. They are very quiet, and the sound quality is exceptional. I like them better than the Bose headphones because they lie flat in their case. I wore then 18 hours straight (including sleeping in them) on a recent flight to Australia. I can't say enough good about them.
customer_reviews.author: Ken F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: You can't get any better than these headphones in my opinion. I use them on the plane when traveling and it makes the flight so much more enjoyable. If you use them in conjunction with a set of ear plugs and turn on some soft music you can drown out almost all noises and even catch a few winks before landing. Great product. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SmartShopper

customer_reviews.title: Compare to Bose Sound Proof Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Not such a snug fit around the ears as the Bose. Sound quality is different and like the Bose superior, although the bass response is not as prominent. I have settled into using these when I work and the Bose for travelling - less hassle folding the cans away. Battery life is shorter with these headphones. I am not sure what the extra $50 got me, but a very nice product and excellent sound quality now I amused to it. I do find it a fiddle though bending the cans in and am concerned I am going to break something. It remains to be seen if the headphones will last as long and as well as my Bose.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Oglethorpe

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've worn both these and the Bose....they are about the same quality for less money and appear to be well made. I'm leaving in a few weeks on a long work trip with lots of air travel and some dorm life. Hoping these give me some piece and quiet. The ability to use them when the batteries die is a real plus. The talk through is nice too. Buttons are pretty easy to operate after you wear the unit for awhile. They do appear fairly fragile...I hope they last.
customer_reviews.author: sylvan rocks climbing

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and noise cancellation is not working well.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great. The music is very natural. No base tilt like in many others. I also loved the feature where you can press a button and talk to other people without taking these off. However, these have a major flaw. If you turn your head on a plane they start making a noise that is very disrupting. You have to sit just right for these to work. While not a deal breaker like the noise cancelation issue, these are also very bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri Furman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality while they worked
customer_reviews.text: They stopped working after about two years of light use. Good quality while they worked, but definitely not worth the price tag for the limited working time
customer_reviews.author: A.J Horst

customer_reviews.title: Love these already
customer_reviews.text: I received these just yesterday and am very pleased. I'm hearing impaired so in the past I had to deal with everyone hearing what I was listening to because the volume was up so loud. The noise canceling is perfect. I'm blasting them right now in the car and nobody else can hear it at all. They also feel well made and extremely comfortable. Very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy70

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for travelers and/or office workers
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for almost six months and the are still going strong; should they hold up the will move on to 5-star territory. Update: October 2012. I've had these for almost a year now, they get near daily use, and they are holding up wonderfully well. The hinges on the earphones are still crisp and tight, and the unit shows no signs of wear. Congrats, you're now five-star approved.
customer_reviews.author: Art History Professor

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones -- don't buy bose. In a perfect world they might be a little smaller.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are solid. Like many other reviews indicated, you don't get quite the same noise cancellation as the Bose equivalent. What you do get however is a much more durable product. I compared side-by-side with the Boise in a store and sitting next to a guy on the plane --- no comparison. The cordage, buttons and overall engineering of the Sennheiser is obviously built to last. The only possible negative is the size. They come with a pretty burly carrying case, but they are considerably bigger than most headphones in this class. It seems like the extra size is part of the noise cancellation strategy with Sennheiser. It could also be what get's you the depth of sound.
customer_reviews.author: tom tresslar

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished, Absolutely Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get the refurbished version of these headphones despite the lack of reviews about those specifically. I know you can never really be sure what you're going to get when you order a refurbished product, but at nearly half the cost, how could I not give it a shot? I was amazed. They were in fantastic condition, and work phenomenally. I've been slowly upgrading my headphones over the years. I went from Skullcandys to Sony's middle-end noise cancelling headphones. These headphones blew both of those out of the water. Definitely worth the price I paid, and the sound is amazing; especially for recording (which is what I plan on using them most for).
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Headphones work great but noise cancellation gets turned on and drains battery
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are great but I agree with another reviewer the button to turn on/off the noise cancellation gets turned on too easily when the head phones are in the storage case, draining the single AAA battery. I've gone ahead and started removing the battery when I store the headphones in their case. This way I know I'll have a still charged battery the next time I head to the airport for a business trip.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: It is a good noise cancelling headphone. Unfortunately, the switch for "Normal/Bypass" was only glue on the headphone. It was broken after two weeks of use. I wonder why do they have to have such a switch? My AudioTech only has a power "On/Off" switch on the phone. I always like a simple design with more quality but less switches. Later, I bought a new set of PXC 450 from a reputable Hi-Fi store. So far so good. I haven't touched the "Normal/Bypss" switch at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Best sound
customer_reviews.text: I've sampled a few noise cancelling headphones recently. These are the best as far as sound is concered, in my opinion. I listened to various types of music and it was an absolute joy! my only complaint about the headphones is the size. I thought the cups were a bit big and didn't hug my ears like some of the other brands. As other reviews have stated, they are big headphones; I would like to see them a little more compacct. As far as sound goes though, these were the best.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound when correctly in place on head
customer_reviews.text: Phones are large but present a quality look and feel. Sound is excellent. Initially I experienced an annoying low-frequency pulsation in the noise cancelling mode and was very dissastified, but once I figured out how to wear the phones so the bottom of the earcup sealed properly against my head, the oscillation disappeared and the sound and noise calcellation was supurb. The included instructions should caution and instruct the owner how to wear the phones to avoid this issue.
customer_reviews.author: tjgust

customer_reviews.title: Excellent noise cancel and sound quality.  Best I've tried for classical.
customer_reviews.text: I listen primarily to classical music and opera, which requires good high-end reproduction. I tried the Bose headphones, but found them to be too "bass-heavy" for my music. The Bose cut off the high overtones of the strings and opera vocals. I use these on every flight. Only disadvantage is that you cannot use them without a battery, so carry some spares.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S.

customer_reviews.title: Ticking noise
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality and solid construction make me want to give these headphones 5 stars. However one major flaw forced me to store these cans after a couple of weeks. When listening to music without noise canceling, the battery makes a ticking sound that is too distracting. To eliminate it I have to remove the battery. This is simply too inconvenient to justify a higher ranking.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R

customer_reviews.title: Regrettably Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Upon going through the reviews posted on this site pertaining to this headphone I decided to order the model for use in my travels. I was looking for high quality sound recognizing that the noise canceling feature would not be as impressive as the Bose Q 15 set. My disappointment consisted of the poor sound quality and volume strength of the Sennheiser PXC 450 compared to the Bose Q 15 or other brands for that matter. I ended up returning the Sennheiser PXC 450 and keeping the Bose headset as I was impressed by the noise canceling and was pleasantly impressed with the quality and sharpness of the sound, that I was not expecting at all.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Once again the saying you get what you pay for proves out
customer_reviews.text: These are a quality product. Pure plain and simple the best headphones I have ever owned. The quality is evident from the first moment I picked them up. And it only got better as I used them.
customer_reviews.author: Zeality

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: The noise reduction is ok for noises that are repetitive, like engines and so. It does not cancel any conversation around or any sudden noise, like something crashing or bumping, etc. The sound of headphones is great. The bass is good and not loud and it has a good frequency range response.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foray into high-end headphones, noise-canceling or otherwise. I've only used them for a few hours, and can honestly say this is the best sound I've ever experienced. New notes are cropping up everywhere, I listened to everything from metal to classical and everything sounds great. The fit is decent, they are snug but not too tight. I imagine they could be considered bulky but that's not very important for me. I've yet to see how they break in but so far quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Yuli Talyansky

customer_reviews.title: Great Music Reproduction
customer_reviews.text: I had some initial concern about these head phones after reading other reviews regarding the noise cancelling feature. I agree, the noise cancelling feature on these headphones is not as good as Bose, but the music reproduction and durability of manufacture more than make up for that. These headphones are a bit bigger and bulkier than the Bose product, but I like them better. I own both these Sennheisers and the Bose "Over-the-Ear" model and I much prefer the Sennheiser product and its construction. The Bose just seems flimsy by comparison. However, if you are more interesed in a complete blotting out of all ambient noise than you are in better music reproduction, go with the Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful item
customer_reviews.text: These work well to block out noise as I listen to music. I bought these when I was a student and the home was very noisy (teens and tenants). I still use them when I have work to do and people are watching TV. They work so well! I use them for plane flights as well! Love them. Very comfortable. Great sound quality
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, fit, comfort, noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I was first impressed by the sound, and then I realized I had it in bypass mode, so it was totally passive, and that impressed me so much. It fits great and is incredibly comfortable. The noise cancellation is amazing. Half the time I don't even turn it on because the passive noise cancellation is so good by itself, and then when I turn it on, it's phenomenal. I love the TalkThrough function. I even use it in one of my classes, I'm in this huge lecture hall where I can hardly hear the professor, so I'll pop on the headphones and TalkThrough and I can hear my prof so clear. AMazing purchase, my audiophile friend even approves.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Medansky

customer_reviews.title: the sound cancellation is not good (is very little)
customer_reviews.text: travelled with this in flight of 15 hrs did very little sound cancelling very dissapointed would not sugest to people to buy it .i think bose is better cost little more.i brought this because it is no. 1 in top ten reviews.
customer_reviews.author: seon kurulkar

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra $ and get a BOSE
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd save a few bucks and get this over the BOSE, but bought my girlfriend the BOSE. Thought it was okay on the flights I took alone, but when we traveled together and I tried hers, I found myself at the BESTBUY kiosk on our layover buying a BOSE.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Noise Cancelling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are fantastic! I fly quite a lot for work, and they help reduce the fatigue of travel by lessening the impact of the engine noise. In addition, I use them at the office to help block out the noise of air conditioners, servers, computers and fluro light humming, and find I'm much less fatigued as a result. They come with a travel case that packs the headphones quite flat, about and inch or 2.5cm thick. I also found I could carry them fairly comfortably around my neck for short periods (eg walking through the airport), and the removable cord means no tangles when leaving your seat on the plane for necessary breaks. I HIGHLY recommend
customer_reviews.author: edtechgirl

customer_reviews.title: I found them comfortable on my ears and head--a significant plus
customer_reviews.text: I used these on an overseas airline flight. They were OK but somewhat disappointing. I found them comfortable on my ears and head--a significant plus. They muffled the sound around me somewhat, but not as much as I had expected. It cut the sound, including the hum of the airplane enough so that the ride didn't bother me, so I kept them.
customer_reviews.author: Truthteller

customer_reviews.title: Recieved a bad pair at first, but the replacements sound superb.
customer_reviews.text: First pair I received were opened, missing their accessories and had bad tweeters. They sounded like absolute crap. Amazon replaced them and the new pair sound great. They sound just like my Sennheiser HD 280 Pro, but have active isolation.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: These sound very good and block airplane and car noise well
customer_reviews.text: These sound very good and block airplane and car noise well. However, they aren't good enough for mowing the lawn with a gas-powered mower.
customer_reviews.author: that dude

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable on your ears but it drains batteries like crazy
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation is great and is very comfortable, but the battery runs out so fast. I have to constantly keep changing batteries. I wish there was a feature by which if there is no input signal, it would turn off so that the batteries dont get drained.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: My husband travels extensively so I purchased these for him a few years ago. The active noise canceling is extremely effective, and the pure sounds of whatever he is listening to, makes this a great product. I had to reorder another pair because he left his first pair on the plane. No one returned them. Hmm. Go figure!
customer_reviews.author: L'esprit

customer_reviews.title: Breathtakingly great
customer_reviews.text: Breathtaking sound quality. Comfy, large pads fit around the outside of the ear so they don't press my ear against my glasses. Thick top of the head pads are soft. Listen to Peter Gabriel's Zaar with these on. So good.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great sound reducer
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted headphones for travel. When he opened them he couldnt stop thanking us for the best headphpnes ever. He said they are top notch for comfort, quietness, and sound. The fact that they fold and have a case make it even better. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: C M Koerner

customer_reviews.title: Like an aural spa!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Work as advertised. No headset will give you complete silence. Everyone talks about the sound isolation and noise drop (I'm guessing about 20db) But what surprised me was the relaxation factor! Yes I could still hear activity on board the aircraft, but as i read it was easier to concentrate and I dozed comfortably as well. I carry them with me all the time for the "unexpected" environments. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Whatley

customer_reviews.title: Hi FI headphones
customer_reviews.text: Best used for quiet listening. The cushions are comfortable and the sound deadening is good. Not great for bass and the sound pressure limit is low. In a music band setting at loud volumes, the kick drum clips. Good for watching TV, listening to classical music
customer_reviews.author: Yo Avg Joe

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These feel great on my head - I could wear them all day. The noise cancelling is okay. I haven't compared them directly to any other pair. They come in a very nice firm case with a bunch of adapters. One of the nicest things is that you can use them even if your batteries run out, just they won't noise cancel.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: They sound better than the qc 25 but for noise canceling it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Very decent sound for noise canceling headphones but the canceling aspect is a bit weak. They sound better than the qc 25 but for noise canceling it's not even close the QC's blow them away.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Best  noise reduction phones Ihave used
customer_reviews.text: The "other" most well known noise cancelling is good, these are great , just used them on a visit to china.. The sound quality is great, talk through button is a good feature and unlike "other" headphones, if battery runs flat you can still at least use them without the Noise cancelling
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Great Pairs.....beat Bose QC15 by a mile
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pair of headphones....I have used QC15s a lot (not own them though) and these things simply blow them out of the water. Way better sound than Bose plus the Talk Through feature is a master stroke. Agree, Bose is better when it comes to noise cancellation, but the fact is that while on a flight and playing music, you just can't tell whose noise cancellation is better. So, it levels out with Bose in noise cancellation, then beats it dead in terms of pure sound quality. Worth its $450 tag and the fact that I got it at 42% discount simply makes it much more awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Pranjal Chaubey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing sound reproduction.
customer_reviews.text: I was comparing these with a pair of old Bose QuiteComfort 2 headphones. Sound reproduction is very disappointing. It is mostly mid range, low and high ranges are barely noticeable. While they priced to be competitive with Bose they really do not come close in range of sound reproduction. I had several Sennheiser products in the past and they all were exceptional quality. Sending them back today.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Perlin

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality sound. Very comfortable. They give a good amount of passive noise isolation if you ensure a good seal around your ears. Active noise cancelling works very well. My only complaint would be that the switch to bypass the active noise cancelling (allowing you to listen to audio without using battery power) is in an awkward place and requires removing the headphones to access. It would be nice to be able to toggle the bypass feature without removing the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J. Mishtal

customer_reviews.title: These are very good headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these headphones. I like that they come in a nice,sturdy travel case and different connecters for airplanes etc. The noise reduction works well. It is great that with the touch of a button, you can listen to outside noise. The price was very good and the shipment was fast.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser PXC 450 headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent headphones. The sound quality is superior and the comfort is awesome. My previous headphones were a pair of Sennheiser HD 595, which were also superior headphones, but after owning them for many year with many hours of use, they started to crack around the headband. The headband on the PXC's has a better build than the old 595s. My son has a new pair of the Beats by Dre headphones and in a side-by-side comparison, the Sennheisers sound much better. I highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gassen

customer_reviews.title: Really? For this price!
customer_reviews.text: I have now used these headphones for around four hours.....hopefully I can leave a positive update in the future. As other reviews have said the noise cancellation qualities are fair to good. But the sound quality? The mids to highs are fairly crisp and accurate. But where is the bass? The lower frequencies are just about completely missing. For this kind of price, I'm VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: Colin Lovdahl

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for headphones for traveling and notice Sennheiser PXC 450 headphoones. I have several Sennheiser headphones and have no complaints. This traveling headphone is perfect. Great sound (like Jazz) and the noise cancelation works perfectly on the plane.
customer_reviews.author: John Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. Comfortable. Have worn it for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Mosquera

customer_reviews.title: Awesomme with a headphone amp.
customer_reviews.text: You need to use a headphone amp to drive these properly' than they sound unbelievable. Portable electronics simply do not push enough power for these. 4 stars cause I use an amp. Very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

product_meta.title: Sennheiser PXC 450 Active Noise-Canceling Headphones
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Sennheiser PXC 450 is a premium around-the-ear travel headphone set featuring Sennheiser’s exclusive NoiseGard 2.0 active noise compensation system, which effectively reduces up to 90% of ambient noise. Adaptive baffle damping and patented Duofol diaphragm technology deliver pristine audio production. The extremely comfortable headphones offer audiophile-grade sound combined with a foldable construction for maximum enjoyment and convenient storage.For any further queries, please reach out to Sennheiser's Technical Support @ 1-877-736-6434 ext. 3

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The Sennheiser PXC 450 is a premium around-the-ear travel headphone set featuring Sennheiser's exclusive NoiseGard 2.0 active noise compensation system, which effectively reduces up to 90% of ambient noise. Adaptive baffle damping and patented Duofol diaphragm technology deliver pristine audio production. The extremely comfortable headphones offer audiophile-grade sound combined with a foldable construction for maximum enjoyment and convenient storage.

Premium travel headphone set with exclusive NoiseGard 2.0 NOISEGARD 2.0 AND TALKTHROUGH TECHNOLOGY
The switchable NoiseGard 2.0 technology reduces ambient noise up to 90%, with active/bypass mode for use as a noise cancelling or closed-back audiophile headphone. The innovative new TalkThrough function allows the user to communicate with neighbors without taking off the headphones. Unwanted background noise, such as the roar of the airplane engines, is filtered out so that only the neighbor’s voice is passed on through the headphones at top quality.

Comfortable headphones offer audiophile-grade sound combined with a foldable construction Just one AAA battery is all it takes for up to 16 hours of serene enjoyment with NoiseGard 2.0 and TalkThrough technology. The PXC 450 also functions as a passive headset when used without batteries, so audio always works. A simple-to-use volume control is integrated into the headphone.

USER-REPLACEABLE PARTS
The Sennheiser HD 280 PRO features rugged construction with user-replaceable parts, including the cable and the earpads. The single-sided, coiled cable has a 3.5mm mini jack and comes with a locking 1/4" adapter for home or studio stereo equipment, as well as an In-Flight Entertainment adapter for airplanes.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
Sennheiser PXC 450 Headphones, transport case, 2 audio adapters (In-flight-Entertainment and 6.3mm), 2 AAA batteries, warranty.

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * Attenuation (passive): Up to 32 dB
 * Power: One AAA battery
 * Cable length: 4.6 ft. (1.4 m)
 * Connector: 3.5mm
 * Frequency response (headphones): 8 - 28,000 Hz
 * Impedance: 150/750 Ohms
 * Sound pressure level (SPL): 108 dB SPL
 * Total harmonic distortion (THD): < 0.1%
 * Transducer type: Dynamic
 * Weight: 8.5 oz. (240 g)
feature_bullets: Outstanding sound thanks to adaptive baffle damping and patented Duofol diaphragm
Best possible protection from outside noise (up to 90%) with NoiseGard technology
Talk through function allows you to talk undisturbed while wearing headphones
Full accessories: soft case, 2 audio adapters (in-flight entertainment and 6.3mm/1/4"), batteries. Audio always works, even in passive mode and without batteries.
Please Note: Kindly refer the User Manual before use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars577 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
